    Test # 2 - Default Constructor.

        Initial value of default BitArray32 = 00000000
        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask1 = 00000200

    Test # 3 - First overloaded Constructor.

        Initial value of Overloaded BitArray32 = 00000040
        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask2 = 00000240
        Bit 7 was truend OFF. Mask2 = 00000200
        Bit 10 is ON
        Bit 7 is OFF
        Bit 10 is NOT OFF
        Bit 7 is OFF

        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask1 = 00000200

        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask2 = 00000240
        Bit 7 was truend OFF. Mask2 = 00000200
        Bit 10 is ON
        Bit 7 is OFF
        Bit 10 is NOT OFF
        Bit 7 is OFF

2016-04-28 00:20:28 - Mark the classes as CSL compliant, which should get around
                      the fact that the System.SByte type is non-compliant. This
                      also required the original class, BitArray32, to be marked
                      as out of compliance, due to its extensive use of UInt32,
                      which is out of compliance, as are the other two unsigned
                      integer types, UInt16 and UInt64.

    Test # 2 - Default Constructor.

        Initial value of default BitArray32 = 00000000
        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask1 = 00000200

    Test # 3 - First overloaded Constructor.

        Initial value of Overloaded BitArray32 = 00000040
        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask2 = 00000240
        Bit 7 was truend OFF. Mask2 = 00000200
        Bit 10 is ON
        Bit 7 is OFF
        Bit 10 is NOT OFF
        Bit 7 is OFF

        /// <summary>
        /// Override the ToString method to provide additional useful outputs,
        /// such as a couple of optional binary (bit level) formats.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="format">
        /// In keeping with the standard nomenclature, this format string gives
        /// details about the output format desired.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        public string ToString ( string format )
        {

+       this                                    {00000000}                                          WizardWrx.BitArray32
        format                                  "G"                                                 string

            return BitHelpers.FormatBitMask (
                _uintBitMask ,
                format );
        }   // public override string ToString (1 of 2)


        /// <summary>
        /// Format a bit mask; this method is intended to implement the ToString
        /// overload on the BitArray classes.
        /// </summary>
        /// <typeparam name="T">
        /// Though not enforced by the compiler, the input must be an integral
        /// type, though it is left to this method to enforce it at run time.
        /// </typeparam>
        /// <param name="pgenBitMask">
        /// Specify the bit mask to format, which must be an integral type.
        /// System.Byte is considered an integral type that stores 8 bits.
        /// </param>
        /// <param name="pstrFormatString">
        /// Specify the format string, which must be either "G" by itself,
        /// or "B" followed by a positive integer less than the number of bits
        /// represented by pgenBitMask.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// if the function succeeds, the return value is a string containing a
        /// 1 or 0 for each bit in pgenBitMask.
        /// </returns>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentOutOfRangeException">
        /// An ArgumentOutOfRangeException exception is thrown when the bits per
        /// group suffix is less than zero.
        /// </exception>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentException">
        /// An ArgumentException exception is thrown when the bits per group
        /// suffix is non-numeric.
        /// </exception>
        internal static string FormatBitMask<T> ( T pgenBitMask , string pstrFormatString )
        {

        pgenBitMask                             0x00000000                                          uint
        pstrFormatString                        "G"                                                 string
+       fpFormattingParams                      null                                                WizardWrx.FormattingParameters
        bclTypeInfo                             null                                                WizardWrx.BCLIntegerTypeInfo
        strGeneralFormatString                  null                                                string
        strWorkFormat                           null                                                string
        FORMAT_ITEM_PREFIX                      "{0:"                                               string
        FORMAT_ITEM_SUFFIX                      0x007d '}'                                          char
        HEX_DIGITS_PER_BYTE                     0x00000004                                          int
-       Type variables
        T                                       uint                                                uint

            const string FORMAT_ITEM_PREFIX = "{0:";
            const char FORMAT_ITEM_SUFFIX = '}';
            const int HEX_DIGITS_PER_BYTE = 4;

            FormattingParameters fpFormattingParams = ParseFormatString ( pstrFormatString );


        /// <summary>
        /// Parse the format string, returning the outcome through a new
        /// FormattingParameters instance.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="pstrFormatString">
        /// Specify the formatting string to parse.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// If the function succeeds, it returns a fully populated
        /// FormattingParameters object.
        /// </returns>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentOutOfRangeException">
        /// An ArgumentOutOfRangeException exception is thrown when the bits per
        /// group suffix is less than zero.
        /// </exception>
        /// <exception cref="ArgumentException">
        /// An ArgumentException exception is thrown when the bits per group
        /// suffix is non-numeric.
        /// </exception>
        internal static FormattingParameters ParseFormatString ( string pstrFormatString )
        {

        pstrFormatString                        "G"                                                 string
        enmDesiredFormat                        General                                             WizardWrx.FormattingParameters.FormatCode
        intBitsPerGroup                         0x00000000                                          int

            FormattingParameters.FormatCode enmDesiredFormat = FormattingParameters.FormatCode.General;
            int intBitsPerGroup = FormattingParameters.SUPPRESS_GROUPING;

            if ( pstrFormatString.Length == LEN_MINIMUM )
            {
                switch ( pstrFormatString [ POS_PREFIX ] )
                {
                    case FORMAT_GENERAL:
                        enmDesiredFormat = FormattingParameters.FormatCode.General;
                        break;
                    case FORMAT_BITS:
                        enmDesiredFormat = FormattingParameters.FormatCode.Bits;
                        break;
                }   // switch ( pstrFormatString [ POS_PREFIX ] )
            }   // TRUE (simplest case) block, if ( pstrFormatString.Length == LEN_MINIMUM )
            else
            {
                string strBitsPerGroup = pstrFormatString.Substring ( POS_MODIFIER );

                if ( int.TryParse ( strBitsPerGroup , out intBitsPerGroup ) )
                {
                    if ( intBitsPerGroup < FormattingParameters.SUPPRESS_GROUPING )
                    {
                        throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException (
                            ARGNAME_FORMAT_STRING ,
                            pstrFormatString ,
                            Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_BIT_GROUPSIZE_OUT_OF_RANGE );
                    }   // if ( intBitsPerGroup < FormattingParameters.SUPPRESS_GROUPING )
                }   // TRUE (anticipated outcome) block, if ( int.TryParse ( strBitsPerGroup , out intBitsPerGroup ) )
                else
                {
                    throw new ArgumentException (
                        string.Format (
                            Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_BIT_GROUPSIZE_MUST_BE_NUMERIC ,
                            pstrFormatString ,
                            QUOTE_CHAR ) ,
                        ARGNAME_FORMAT_STRING );
                }   // FALSE (unanticipated outcome) block, if ( int.TryParse ( strBitsPerGroup , out intBitsPerGroup ) )
            }   // FALSE (more complex case) block, if ( pstrFormatString.Length == LEN_MINIMUM )

            return new FormattingParameters (
                enmDesiredFormat ,
                intBitsPerGroup );
        }   // ParseFormatString

            BCLIntegerTypeInfo bclTypeInfo = InfoForType ( pgenBitMask.GetType ( ) );

        /// <summary>
        /// Get the BCLIntegerTypeInfo for a specified type.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="ptypForThisType">
        /// Specify the Type for which BCLIntegerTypeInfo is required. The
        /// TypeHandle is extracted and used as the index.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// If the function succeeds, the return value is the desired
        /// BCLIntegerTypeInfo object. Otherwise, the return value is null.
        /// </returns>
#if BCLINTEGERTYPEINFO_PUBLIC
        public static BCLIntegerTypeInfo InfoForType ( Type ptypForThisType )
#else
        internal static BCLIntegerTypeInfo InfoForType ( Type ptypForThisType )
#endif  // #if BCLINTEGERTYPEINFO_PUBLIC
        {

        intNTypes                               0x00000000                                          int

        intHandle                               0x000000006f428978                                  long

            int intNTypes = s_abclintegertypeinfo.Length;

        intNTypes                               0x00000007                                          int

            for ( int intCurrItem = ARRAY_FIRST_ELEMENT ; intCurrItem < intNTypes ; intCurrItem++ )
                if ( s_abclintegertypeinfo [ intCurrItem ].BCLType.TypeHandle.Value.ToInt64 ( ) == intHandle )
                    return s_abclintegertypeinfo [ intCurrItem ];

            return null;
        }   // public static BCLIntegerTypeInfo InfoForType

        +       BCLType                         {System.UInt32}                                     System.Type {System.RuntimeType}
                CapacityInBits                  0x00000020                                          int
                CompactGUIDString               "404e854f6daf303d860ae9722c85e9a3"                  string
        +       GUIDPerType                     {4f854e40-af6d-3d30-860a-e9722c85e9a3}              System.Guid
                IsSigned                        false                                               bool
                MaximumDecimalDigits            0x0000000a                                          int
                RequiredStorageBytes            0x00000004                                          int

            string strGeneralFormatString = string.Concat (
                FORMAT_GENERAL ,
                ( bclTypeInfo.RequiredStorageBytes * HEX_DIGITS_PER_BYTE ) );
            string strWorkFormat = string.Format (
                string.Concat (
                    FORMAT_ITEM_PREFIX ,
                    strGeneralFormatString ,
                    FORMAT_ITEM_SUFFIX ) ,
                pgenBitMask );

            //  ----------------------------------------------------------------
            //  For the General case, formatting is done, but for the Bits case,
            //  we're just getting underway.
            //  ----------------------------------------------------------------

            switch ( fpFormattingParams.FormatPrefix )
            {
                case FormattingParameters.FormatCode.General:
                    return strWorkFormat;
                case FormattingParameters.FormatCode.Bits:
                    StringBuilder rsbOneCharPerBit = new StringBuilder ( bclTypeInfo.CapacityInBits );
                    return rsbOneCharPerBit.ToString ( );
                default:
                    string strMsg = string.Format (
                        Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_INVALID_FORMAT_PREFIX_ENUM ,
                        ( int ) fpFormattingParams.FormatPrefix );
                    System.Diagnostics.Debug.Fail ( strMsg );
                    return strMsg;
            }   // switch ( fpFormattingParams.FormatPrefix )
        }   // FormatBitMask<T>

2016-04-28 13:28:09 - Do over; I set up the format string incorrectly.

        #region ICustomFormatter Members
        /// <summary>
        /// Format integral types as arrays of bits. Other types are handed off
        /// to the system formatting engine.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="format">
        /// Specify the format string to apply. This method supports a custom
        /// format code, B, and the standard G code.
        /// </param>
        /// <param name="arg">
        /// Specify the integral type to format.
        /// </param>
        /// <param name="formatProvider">
        /// Specify the accompanying format provider.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// If the method succeeds and the format code is B, the return value is
        /// a string that represents the integral type as a string of bits,
        /// listed from most significant to least.
        ///
        /// If the method succeeds and the format code is G, the return value is
        /// a hexadecimal representation of the integer, sufficiently padded to
        /// hold the maximum value supported by an integer of the specified type.
        ///
        /// All other cases are handed over to the default formatting engine and
        /// the outcome is undefined, since it depends upon the behavior of a
        /// component that is outside of my control.
        /// </returns>
        string ICustomFormatter.Format (
            string format ,
            object arg ,
            IFormatProvider formatProvider )
        {

        this                                            {WizardWrx.BitMaskFormat}                                                                                               WizardWrx.BitMaskFormat
        format                                          "B"                                                                                                                     string
        arg                                             0x00                                                                                                                    object {byte}
-       formatProvider                                  {WizardWrx.BitMaskFormat}                                                                                               System.IFormatProvider {WizardWrx.BitMaskFormat}
                [WizardWrx.BitMaskFormat]               {WizardWrx.BitMaskFormat}                                                                                               WizardWrx.BitMaskFormat

                      BitHelpers method that should return a BCLIntegerTypeInfo.

        /// <summary>
        /// Get the BCLIntegerTypeInfo for a specified type.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="ptypForThisType">
        /// Specify the Type for which BCLIntegerTypeInfo is required. The
        /// TypeHandle is extracted and used as the index.
        /// </param>
        /// <returns>
        /// If the function succeeds, the return value is the desired
        /// BCLIntegerTypeInfo object. Otherwise, the return value is null.
        /// </returns>
#if BCLINTEGERTYPEINFO_PUBLIC
        public static BCLIntegerTypeInfo InfoForType ( Type ptypForThisType )
#else
        internal static BCLIntegerTypeInfo InfoForType ( Type ptypForThisType )
#endif  // #if BCLINTEGERTYPEINFO_PUBLIC
        {

+       ptypForThisType                                 {System.Byte}                                                                                                           System.Type {System.RuntimeType}

            Int64 intHandle = ptypForThisType.TypeHandle.Value.ToInt64 ( );

        intHandle                                       0x000000006f453868                                                                                                      long

            int intNTypes = s_abclintegertypeinfo.Length;

        intCurrItem                                     0x00000000                                                                                                              int
        intNTypes                                       0x00000007                                                                                                              int

            for ( int intCurrItem = ARRAY_FIRST_ELEMENT ; intCurrItem < intNTypes ; intCurrItem++ )
                if ( s_abclintegertypeinfo [ intCurrItem ].BCLType.TypeHandle.Value.ToInt64 ( ) == intHandle )
                    return s_abclintegertypeinfo [ intCurrItem ];

            return null;
        }   // public static BCLIntegerTypeInfo InfoForType

            if ( BitHelpers.InfoForType ( arg.GetType ( ) ) != null )
            {
                return BitHelpers.FormatBitMask ( arg , format );           <<---- Control passes this way.
                return BitHelpers.FormatBitMask ( 0x00 , "B" );
            }   // TRUE (anticipated outcome) block, if ( BitHelpers.InfoForType ( arg.GetType ( ) ) != null )
            else
            {
                if ( arg is IFormattable )
                {   // Arg is a type that implements the IFormattable interface.
                    return ( ( IFormattable ) arg ).ToString ( format , System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture );
                }   // if ( arg is IFormattable )
                else if ( arg != null )
                {   // Arg isn't null, but it doesn't implement IFormattable.
                    return arg.ToString ( );
                }   // else if ( arg != null )
                else
                {   // Arg doesn't implement IFormattable, and, moreover, is a null reference.
                    return string.Empty;
                }   // else neither ( arg is IFormattable ), nor ( arg != null ) is true.
            }   // FALSE (degenerate case) block, if ( BitHelpers.InfoForType ( arg.GetType ( ) ) != null )
        }   // public string ICustomFormatter.Format
        #endregion  // ICustomFormatter Members

        Bit 10 is ON
        Bit 7 is OFF
        Bit 10 is NOT OFF
        Bit 7 is OFF

        Bit 10 is ON
        Bit 7 is OFF
        Bit 10 is NOT OFF
        Bit 7 is OFF

        Bit 7 is OFF

        Bit 7 is OFF

        internal static string FormatBitMask<T> ( T pgenBitMask , string pstrFormatString )
        {

        pgenBitMask                                     0x00                                                                                                                    object {byte}
        pstrFormatString                                "B4"                                                                                                                    string

            const string FORMAT_ITEM_PREFIX = "{0:";
            const char FORMAT_ITEM_SUFFIX = '}';
            const int HEX_DIGITS_PER_BYTE = 2;

            FormattingParameters fpFormattingParams = ParseFormatString ( pstrFormatString );

                _intBitsPerGroup                        0x00000004                                                                                                              int
                BitsPerGroup                            0x00000004                                                                                                              int
                FormatPrefix                            Bits                                                                                                                    WizardWrx.FormattingParameters.FormatCode

                        ARGNAME_BITS_PER_GROUP          "pintBitsPerGroup"                                                                                                      string
                        SUPPRESS_GROUPING               0x00000000                                                                                                              int

            BCLIntegerTypeInfo bclTypeInfo = InfoForType ( pgenBitMask.GetType ( ) );

-       bclTypeInfo                                     {WizardWrx.BCLIntegerTypeInfo}                                                                                          WizardWrx.BCLIntegerTypeInfo

        +       _typBCLType                             {System.Byte}                                                                                                           System.Type {System.RuntimeType}

                CapacityInBits                          0x00000008                                                                                                              int
        +       GUIDPerType                             {9b957340-adba-3234-91ea-46a5c9bff530}                                                                                  System.Guid
                IsSigned                                false                                                                                                                   bool
                MaximumDecimalDigits                    0x00000003                                                                                                              int
                RequiredStorageBytes                    0x00000001                                                                                                              int

            string strGeneralFormatString = string.Concat (
                HEXADECIMAL ,
                ( bclTypeInfo.RequiredStorageBytes * HEX_DIGITS_PER_BYTE ) );

        strGeneralFormatString                          "x2"                                                                                                                    string

            string strWorkFormat = string.Format (
                string.Concat (
                    FORMAT_ITEM_PREFIX ,
                    strGeneralFormatString ,
                    FORMAT_ITEM_SUFFIX ) ,
                pgenBitMask );

        strWorkFormat                                   "00"                                                                                                                    string

            //  ----------------------------------------------------------------
            //  For the General case, formatting is done, but for the Bits case,
            //  we're just getting underway.
            //  ----------------------------------------------------------------

            switch ( fpFormattingParams.FormatPrefix )
            {
                case FormattingParameters.FormatCode.General:
                    return strWorkFormat;
                case FormattingParameters.FormatCode.Bits:
                    StringBuilder rsbOneCharPerBit = new StringBuilder ( bclTypeInfo.CapacityInBits );

                    foreach ( char chr4Bits in strWorkFormat )
                    {   // Since it happens after the fact, the decision to append a space must precede appending more bits.
                        fpFormattingParams.AddPaddingAsSpecitied ( rsbOneCharPerBit );
                        rsbOneCharPerBit.Append (
                            s_abytAsBits [ Array.BinarySearch<char> (
                                s_achrHexDigit ,
                                chr4Bits ) ] );
                    }   // foreach ( char chr4Bits in strWorkFormat )

                    return rsbOneCharPerBit.ToString ( );
                default:

                        Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_INVALID_FORMAT_PREFIX_ENUM ,
                        ( int ) fpFormattingParams.FormatPrefix );
                    System.Diagnostics.Debug.Fail ( strMsg );
                    return strMsg;
            }   // switch ( fpFormattingParams.FormatPrefix )
        }   // FormatBitMask<T>

        internal static string FormatBitMask<T> ( T pgenBitMask , string pstrFormatString )
        {

        pgenBitMask                                     0x02                                                                                                                    object {byte}
        pstrFormatString                                "B4"                                                                                                                    string

            FormattingParameters fpFormattingParams = ParseFormatString ( pstrFormatString );

-       fpFormattingParams                              {WizardWrx.FormattingParameters}                                                                                        WizardWrx.FormattingParameters

                _intBitsPerGroup                        0x00000004                                                                                                              int
                BitsPerGroup                            0x00000004                                                                                                              int
                FormatPrefix                            Bits                                                                                                                    WizardWrx.FormattingParameters.FormatCode

                HEXADECIMAL ,
                ( bclTypeInfo.RequiredStorageBytes * HEX_DIGITS_PER_BYTE ) );

        BIT_NBR_MAX = 32
        OFF         = False
        ON          = True

    Test # 2 - Default Constructor.

        Initial value of default BitArray32 = 00000000
        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask1 = 00000200

    Test # 3 - First overloaded Constructor.

        Initial value of Overloaded BitArray32 = 00000040
        Bit 10 was turned ON. Mask2 = 00000240
        Bit 7 was turned OFF. Mask2 = 00000200
        Bit 10 is ON
        Bit 7 is OFF
        Bit 10 is NOT OFF
        Bit 7 is OFF

        Bit 7 is OFF
